snippet: In another positive economic report, the Commerce Department said spending on construction projects grew in December.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management reports that manufacturing activity in the United States grew at a faster pace in January, driven by an increase in new orders and more hiring at factories; says its index of manufacturing activity jumped to 53.1 from 50.2 in December; any reading above 50 indicates expansion.
lead_paragraph: In another positive economic report, the Commerce Department said spending on construction projects grew in December.

headline.seo: Manufacturing Activity Rises for Second Consecutive Month
headline.main: Manufacturing Activity Rises for Second Month in a Row
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing Activity Rises For Second Month in a Row
